Title: Andrew Chen: Do you ever say, "MySpace is sooo ugly?" This blog's for you...

Author: downer
Content: I would like to see this expanded with a Streetwalkers category, worth up to 6.9 points.  They are a natural fit for hackers, with similar hours.

Author: dreish
Content:
If you're looking for 100/100, plug in ZIP code 10001 (no address -- puts you around the corner from Madison Square Garden).

83210, in rural Idaho, gets a donut.

Author: mikesabat
Content:
Call them and ask for references. Please be sure to come back and tell us what you found out :)

I don't know anyone that has used them, but I do read Wil's blog often.

Author: mattculbreth
Content: Cool idea, but boy you don't want to depend on Twitter being alive.

Author: nikolaj
Content:
I run a django shop, and my technique for hiring is finding people who preferably have had freelancer experience (know how to get something out the door), know a little (preferably a ton) of bash, actively learn new things, are up on the latest stuff (i should be able to have a conversation about js kits with them), and when i explain the advantages of django to them they show an understanding of Why it is so cool. Python or django is not 'required'.. i can ramp them up on that with lots of little tasks at first.

A big plus is being a unix nerd.

Author: neilc
Content: Cool idea, but I agree that the implementation needs work. The score for my office is 68, but it is really not walkable at all. Whereas the score for my home is only a 62, but I never need to use a car at home.

Author: e1ven
Title: Search for images by Colors
Content: A fiendishly clever tool for searching though databases of phones, and sorting by the right color combinations

Author: tx
Title: Do these guys really help? (helping to raise capital)
Content:
Here at Pikluk (http://pikluk.com) We are in the process of finalizing our business plan and trying to get funded.

I was wondering if any of you guys had any experience dealing with sites like http://www.fundingpost.com and http://www.gobignetwork.com

They all want you to pay to submit a "company profile", not much - hundreds (at least not thousands) of dollars.

But I am wondering - are they for real? I have never heard of any company that got funded this way.

Author: michaelneale
Content: I hope not. The mathematical aspects are about to get a whole lot more important to us.
